page.title: 18GRAVEL PITS
page.content:
Gravel extraction is a major industry in the area south of West Drayton. This area had once been part of the Thames River basin and has left layers of even deposits. All stones below 4 inches are extracted. They are then washed and passed through mats which separates them into various sizes. Larger stones are put into a hop after which they are crushed into the right size. Much of the gravel is being used in the construction of the M 25.
Great care is taken to return the pits to farming land. When digging pits the soil is removed in layers and returned in the same order. This is important as it can effect the drainage of the land and the surrounding area.
